Material used.Description: Mouse brain was subregionally divided into olfactory bulb (OB), cortex (Cx), basal ganglia (Bg), cerebellum (Ce) and brain stem (Bs) for protein extraction.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of human A30P alpha-synuclein was largely restricted to the olfactory bulb with strong signals of monomeric and aggregated forms detected.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple mice (n=4 per group) were analyzed for protein expression levels.

Basic positive control.Description: Human cortex extract was used as a positive control for alpha-synuclein expression.

Basic negative control.Description: Alpha-synuclein knockout mice were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometric analysis using ImageQuant software after normalization to beta-actin.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels comparable to endogenous mouse alpha-synuclein in control mice.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Expression levels significantly higher than endogenous mouse alpha-synuclein, indicating overexpression.

Material used.Description: Brains were dissected and cut into vibratome or cryosections for staining with anti-alpha-synuclein antibodies.

Readout description.Result Description: Strong somatic accumulation of human A30P alpha-synuclein in olfactory bulb layers, particularly in the glomerular layer.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple mice were analyzed for immunohistochemical staining.

Basic negative control.Description: Control mice sections lacking transgenic expression were used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No or minimal immunoreactivity in olfactory bulb layers.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Strong immunoreactivity in olfactory bulb layers, indicating overexpression.

Material used.Description: Brain samples from olfactory bulb, striatum, and midbrain were dissected for neurotransmitter content analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant reduction of dopamine and its metabolites (DOPAC and HVA) in the olfactory bulb, with upregulation of dopamine in midbrain regions.

Biological replicates.Description: Four mice per group were analyzed for neurotransmitter content.

Basic negative control.Description: Age- and sex-matched control mice were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test for pairwise comparisons with post hoc Newman-Keuls test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Dopamine and metabolite levels comparable to control mice.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction or increase in dopamine and metabolite levels compared to control mice (p < 0.05).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Behavioral Testing (Novel Open Field, TMT, Female Urine Smell, Forced Swim Test, PhenoMaster)

Material used.Description: Mice were subjected to various behavioral tests to assess hyperactivity and olfactory processing.

Readout description.Result Description: Hyperactive response under novel and stressful conditions, with altered responses to odors (TMT and female urine), linked to A30P alpha-synuclein expression.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple mice were tested in each behavioral assay (e.g., n=12-18 for PrP_A30P mice).

Basic negative control.Description: Control mice were used as negative controls for behavioral responses.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired two-tailed t-test and 2-way ANOVA for behavioral data analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Behavioral responses comparable to control mice under similar conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in activity or altered behavioral responses compared to control mice (p < 0.05).
